answers.answer: Hello I'm 11 weeks with twins, under IVF in august due date may 2012..Storkgirl thanks for the idea with this new blog

Hi Mintavarez!I remember you from the transfer group!!!  How are you feeling?  Having come off the drugs last week I thought I might feel less symptoms, but I feel no difference - still have my food aversions and I think my chest has become even larger since last week - strange!I had some bleeding last week.  Babies are OK, I have a hematoma which is hopefully shrinking as I type...Great to reconnect with you Mintavarez!!!

Thought it might be fun to have a table with everyone's info like we had in the transfer group, I'll do it chronological by due date:Stock Girl       Twins      April 13, 2012Mintavarez     Twins      May, 2012
Hey! Hey!What a great idea storkgirl!!Had 3 day transfer donor egg, pregnant with singleton due May 14,2012.I am 11 weeks 5days.Feeling well so far!Hope others can join us!!!

It is great to re-connect with you all again, I am 10 weeks 1 day with one baby, due May 24th 2012.I have NO symptoms yet. apart from the cramping after the transfer all is good, Next U.S is on my 12 weeks  Nov 10th, can't wait to see my lil peanut again.Thanks for putting this together. Hope all is well with everyone :-)Big hugs x

Welcome Readhead68 and Scottishmummy!!!  Here is our latest list:StorkGirl                Twins            April 13, 2012Mintavarez            Twins             May, 2012Readhead68         Singleton       May 14, 2012Scottishmummy    Singleton       May 24, 2012
Hey, Guys!!!I am almost 12 weeks with twins! Due May, 2012. My next ultrasound is at 14 weeks.

Welcome Lala!StorkGirl                Twins            April 13, 2012Mintavarez            Twins             May, 2012Lala282                 Twins             May, 2012Readhead68         Singleton       May 14, 2012Scottishmummy    Singleton       May 24, 2012
Hi AllAre you getting the flu shot this year?  There seems to be some debate on pregnant women getting this.  My fertility doc and GP told me to get it.SG

Hello,I have no symptoms with my pregnancy, except that the first month I gain 15 pound but now im doing good.. I stop my meds at 8 weeks thanks god..Last night I felt one of the baby move inside of me lol it was so funny because my hubby didn't believe me then he came and put his hands with a lil of pressure on my left side and he also felt it..Doctor will discharged me to a regular OB Gyn next week.. (sad I don't want to leave her) they were so good to us..

That is amazing that you've had no symptoms Mintavarez!!!  And very amazing that you and your husband felt the baby move - WOW!!!Did the 15 lbs stay with you or was that bloating from the meds?I was supposed to be discharged from the clinic last week but since I've developed this hematoma they are following me with that,  I will be sad to leave the clinic as well.  Everyone there is so kind and having an u/s every week has been great!  Graduating is a good thing though - on to the next adventure, right?!

The weight stay with me...It feels good to be going to the next trimester..I just can't wait to find out the sex of the babies.. 3 or 4 more weeks I will find out... So anxiousAlso doctor recommend me to drink 1,000mg in the am and 1,000mg in the pm of vitamin C.. Suppose to it give strength to the sacs and is also good for us to not get sick with the flu...Hope you feel better and just try to take it easy for now..House duty lightDon't lift anything more than 7 pounds and stress freeI just got back to work last week and house duty hubby is doing it for me (bathrooms, vacuum, laundry and mop the floors)

What a nice hubby, Mintavarez!!!I would like to find out the sexes as well.  I have girls names ready to go, but no boys names yet.Vitamin C sounds like a good idea.I am 13 weeks today - so that means trimester 2 I think.  Hurray!

Big controversy with flu shot, I have never had one and I haven't had the flu in 20 years. Now I do have a bad cold passed on by my hubby.My problem is I have Hashimoto's disease which is an autoimmune disease and a flu shot is not favorable.My endo advised me to get it in 2nd trimester and get the one without the preservative.Mintaverez.....isn't great that now hubbies get to pamper us??!!!!! The work will be coming later with our little bundlesHugs to all you ladies

Redhead!!! My hubby got me sick, too! That's always the case. He gets sick first, gives it to me, and then I get it worse than him. I actually came to our thread to ask what doctor's prescribe.Anyway, it started with a terrible sore throat and in a day it progressed to scratchy with a headache, stuffy nose and overall dead-head. I took a half dose of Tylenol twice yesterday, and  have been sipping hot water, lemon and honey. I've also been drinking 2 liters of water. Did your doctor prescribe anything?  I wanted to know if Saline nasal spray is okay.

I hope you feel better soon Readhead and Lala.  I was wondering about the nasal spray myself.  I've been stuffed up for about two weeks now and it's uncomfortable to sleep.Last night I also had acid reflux.  I received my What to Expect and Baby Centre emails for week 13 yesterday.  They mentioned acid reflux, here I am, right on schedule!!!  It was very painful in the past and I went on meds but don't think I can this time.  The emails mentioned papaya so I'm going to try that.SG

I am beginning to have  acid reflux, too!!! Just the tightness part of it, but I suspect by next week it'll be kicking in. I seem to be on schedule for everything, too. Every time I look something up it seems to be the week I am in.

Hey Lala282/storkgirlMy husband gave me a cold and it is a lot worse than his. His lasted 3 days, mine is 6 days and hasn't ended yet.I have scratchy throat, runny nose, watery eyes and sneezing. The doc said to take Chlor-Trimetron allergy which is safe in early pregnancy, and of course tylenol. I needed something to dry me up. I am taking the tablets when it is absolutely necessary, I usually never take anything, I use only natural herbs and remedies but one must be careful using herbs during pregnancy because some can cause contractions and lead to miscarriage. I followed what my doc suggested and it is taking a while to go away probably because I am really taking very few pills. Also I am taking extra vitamin C which is safe.As far as the saline spray, it is totally safe there is no medication in it. I have been using before the cold because, my nasal passages get dry at night.Hope everyone feels better!!!Hugs.

Sorry, don't know what happened. The site was down and then it posted my comment 5 times????

That happened to me before. I posted to someone about five times due to a computer glitch. I hope you feel better! I'm on day 2.5 of my cold. Hate it! Thanks for letting me know what to take.  Take care!
Hi AllIs anyone else still having night sweats?SG

Hi there- I'm due April 4th with a singleton. So excited to connect with others due in the Spring. There's also another Forum started for those due specifically in April. Congrats to everyone! So far it's been a great pregnancy, not a day of sickness or nausea. I can feel the baby moving all around mow- so amazing!

Hi all!  I am excited to be a part of this group.  I had a FET in Aug. and am pregnant with a singleton due May 14 along with Redhead68 :o)  This is 1st pregnancy and I've had severe nausea the past 6 weeks.  I wanted this so bad so I try not to complain but pregnancy has not been enjoyable yet!  Tomorrow I hit the 12 week mark so I am hoping it will ease up soon.I'm wavering on the flu shot as well.  I have never received one except when the fertility clinic required it before I started.  I'm rarely ever sick.  But, I would hate to cause any harm to the baby when I could have prevented it.  Let me know what you all decide.

Welcome Soccermom2b!!!!!!  Great to have you on board!!Jennifer330           Singleton       April 4, 2012StorkGirl                Twins            April 13, 2012Mintavarez            Twins             May, 2012Lala282                 Twins             May, 2012Redhead68           Singleton       May 14, 2012Soccermom2b       Singleton       May 14, 2012Scottishmummy    Singleton       May 24, 2012

I'll jump in about the flu shot. My OB highly recommends it if you're pregnant during high flu season. I got one at 13 weeks and all is fine now at almost 18 weeks. Just make sure you get it at your doctor's office because they have the preservative free shots. The regular dose you get from your employer or quick clinic has small amount of mercury in it and is NOT recommended for pregnant women. It can be quite dangerous if you get a high fever while pregnant. It's really a personal choice that should be discussed with your OB. It was my first flu shot ever and no side effects- just a little red bump at the injection site.
Thanks for the info!  I'll make sure to request the preservative-free one when they push it at the next appt.

Hi there, how nice you are due on the same day I am. Congrats to you and all the new ladies on board.Yes, I never got the flu shot, but I am rarely sick. I have decided to get one and the preservative free one is the one recommended by my gyno.I don't like the idea but the benefits outweigh the risks.Looking forward to chatting with everyone!

Hi ThereBack from 13.5 week u/s.  Babies grew, but so did hematoma :-(  I really thought it would have shrunk by now.  Another check next Monday.....Thanks all for your input on the flu shot.  I'm with Readhead - don't like the idea, but will get the preservative-free one.sg
Ahh, we do I keep typing Readhead for RedHead - sorry!SG

Hi all,I will add myself to the list...I had IVF in July and am now 16 weeks along with a single...like a lot of you, I was torn about the flu shot in the beginning and was sort of determined not to get one at first, but now that I know my hospital only has the preservative-free kind, I'll get one in the next week or so. I also got a nasty, nasty cold in the first trimester as well...so awful. I was told saline solution was fine, Tylenol, and Benedryl. I just sucked it up and only did the Tylenol and stayed miserable for a week...@Soccormom--so, so glad to hear that your IVF was successful! I remember you from the other group....so excited for you! I know you must be thrilled :)Congrats to everyone!

Does anyone have pelvic pressure? Not the kind where you feel shooting or tugging  pains, or even cramps, but more like a light muscle ache across your pelvic bone. It's not bad, just there this morning. I have a fairly big bump  for 12 weeks, and am having twins. (Actually I am measuring 13 weeks, but technically I am 12).lala

I be having pelvic pressure, went to the doctor yesterday and told me it was normal due to the reason I'm carrying for two and they growing as time goes we going to feel it more...All: glad to hear everyone is doing great : )Monday went for my NT ultrasound test and thanks to God everything came out good...It was so funny to see them  Baby A is the calm one and Baby B is to hyper lol always moving around and doing flip lol it's so funny how they do there own lil thing inside of us..
I asked about pelvic pressure too.  This is the time that your uterus is really growing, I was told to expect it on the sides of my abdomen as well.

Hi All;I am soo happy that we are all here again and can you please add me to this form.  I did my 1st IVF in Sept after 4 failed IUI's and I am due on June 5, 2012 with one baby.  I had OHSS and I just got over it about 2 weeks ago.  I am 9 weeks 2 days today.  I have no symptoms yet just nipples hurts ((sorry TMI)) besides that nothing...=D

Thanks everybody!!! This is the best forum ever. Thanks, SG!! I like that the forum is for IVF-ers due in spring because it just makes it smaller and easier to trade doctor advice and our increasing knowledge on the things that weworry about.Welcome Cleo! My nipples hurt, too, and I'm looking like a porn star. I am very tired today from an ongoing cold, and the zillion trips to the bathroom at night.

Hi Cleto!!  Great to see you here!Jennifer330           Singleton       April 4, 2012StorkGirl                Twins            April 13, 2012Jennie1211            Singleton      April 14, 2012Mintavarez            Twins             May, 2012Lala282                 Twins             May, 2012Redhead68           Singleton       May 14, 2012Soccermom2b       Singleton       May 14, 2012Scottishmummy    Singleton       May 24, 2012Cleto                     Singleton       June 5, 2012

Welcome to all!!!I am sooo happy to connect with you all, I think we can all be helpful to one another.Yesterday I went for my 1st trimester screening and although it was a very long appointment everything looked well so far, final results will be on Friday. My baby looked like he/she was scratching her nose hahahahah!!!!It's a miracle. I think I am finally getting excited, we haven't told anyone yet because we wanted to be sure everything is well and with my history you never know?Hope all you ladies are doing well.Oh lala282 I know what you mean about looking like a porn star.....I am loving it!!!!!!

Welcome & Congrats. great news :-)I am 11 weeks tomorrow and have my 12 weeks on Nov 10th, I have had no symptoms yet. nothing at all, Sometimes I feel I want to take another HT just to be sure  ha ha BUT I have had 3 scan before so cant wait to see my wee peanut next week.I am going through all this myself and just can't wait until I stop injections, as I can only do them on my right hand side (at my back) one more week before I stop them.Keep all the news coming, its great to be with everyone.Big hugs to all XXX

Redhead - Great news!  I am so happy for you!!!Scottishmummy - almost there with the shots!!!!!  You have to celebrate that day!!!Nothing new here - still on bedrest with an u/s on Monday to see if the hematoma is shrinking....hope so.  I have some acid reflux starting.  My doc told me to take Tums and when that is not enough I can get a script..  Night everyone.SG
I'm not pregs yet but hopefully I will go thru IVF this month ... I just wanna follow this thread to see how everyone's experience is ... :)
Hi IHeartForABaby!Welcome!  We'll get you on the board with a due date soon!SG

Well, got my 1st trimester screening results today and the geneticist said the #'s are amazing!!!! We tested for down and trisomy18 and My #' s were 1 in 10,0000. I am 12 weeks 5days and Finally I am getting excited about MY BUN IN THE OVEN!!!!!!hahahahha!!!All the best to all you ladies on this journey!
AWESOME news Redhead!!!!!  Time to cruise through 2nd trimester!!  Congratulations!  SG

Hey sorry I haven't been on in awhile....Got your message and am doing good.  Got over the sickness, now just reflux and indigestion!!!  I am due April 29, am 15 weeks tomorrow.  I am making it so far....

Is anyone measuring the circumference of their belly? I started on Friday and two days later it grew an inch. Maybe I just ate more this morning.

Hi LalaI've started doing this, I'm anywhere between 37-39 inches.  It seems to fluctuate quite a bit for me.  I'm not sure what I was before, maybe 29.  I've really ballooned out and look more pregnant than those 1-2 months ahead of me at work.  They keep saying, "I can't believe how big you are."  Then I remind them that I have two!  It could be bloating too, who knows.  SG

Stuffed Up NoseIf been stuffed up for about 4-5 weeks now.  I've just read this a common symptom of an incrase in progesterone.  I guess those placentas really are capable of making their own hormones!  SG
So glad you started this group! My husband and I used ICSI for a 3 day transfer on our first IVF cycle in August. I had 2 embryos transferred and we are due in May with one sweet little bean!
has anyone thought of cord blood bank?? I have been looking into it but I can not get a price on how much. Does anyone know?Cheers
Hi great forum hop to join in soon.had by day 3 ET on the 20/10. So wish me luck. Want my name on t list too
Sending baby dust to you, good luck and keep us all posted... hope to see you very soon.

Hi ScottishmummyI've looked into the cord banking.  My fertility clinic does this as well as peristem (tissue stem cell) banking.  I am a past leukemia patient who had a bone marrow/stem cell transplant so it would have been great to have stem cells banked when I needed them.For a singleton their fee is $925.  That includes the first year of storage, after that it is $115 per year for storage.   If you do cord blood and peristem, it is $1,570.  $210 for subsequent years.  These rates are for Canada.SG
Thanks for the info. sorry to hear about you, my goodness you really have been put through the works.. you have turned out such a strong person.Big hugs, Cheers

I'm kind of sad.  Yesterday about 5:am went to restroom & a small piece of clot came out looked more like a piece of liver ((it wasn't)) I wipe & it was bright red & ya no more blood came out.  Called my RE & nurse said to be in bed rest. You think there's nothing to worry about??  I used noo pad no cramping nothing.I go to my u/s Thursday 11-10-11PLEASE HELP... :-\

Hi CletoI have sent you a message to your account but it's great it was a small amount of blood and no cramping with it.  I really feel you are going to get great news on Thursday.  Just rest so everything heals up nicely.SG

Thank you Scottishmummy - Everyone has their challenges, just have to take them day by day.Just back from ultrasound, hematoma is smaller and babies are doing great - still one day ahead of schedule - hurray!!!!!SG

Hi there,It is always scary to see any kind of blood, but try to stay calm, it was a small amount and there was no cramping. I know of other women who have had blood throughout their pregnancy and delivered healthy babies.Stay positive, you will get great news on Thursday.You are in my thoughts.
Thank you all so much.  I am better now just taking it ez.  I cannot wait til Thursday.=}

Congrats so happy for you....Went yesterday and baby A it's a boy baby b couldn't see anything hopefully she will be able to see something next week
Hi Lala & Mintzvarez!!How exciting!!!  I was told on Monday that baby A is a boy, Baby B is in question - looks like might be a boy too!!!

Thank you for adding me to the list! :-)We just had our NT scan yesterday and I think it went well. 4 weeks ago I was diagnosed with a subchorionic bleed myself but yesterday my doc said he couldn't see it anymore. I'm still having some discharge (going on 3 weeks of that yucky stuff) but otherwise baby is great! So neat to see it moving around in there. :-)I have a follow up on Monday and we should have our results back by then as well. Hoping to get off bed rest soon!

Lala282  Well it looks like in one shot you may have the perfect family!!! How wonderful. Let us know when they confirm gender. XXOOOMintavarez Congrats to you too!! Hope you are feeling well!Storkgirl congrats!!! you may be having one of each also, fingers crossed.thosenewmans  Congrats!! and welcome to the club and good luck on your next scan.As far as me, I am going for my routine monthly check up next Tuesday and probably won't get gender scan until 20 weeks.As far as gender preference I think I can speak for all of us when I say:" I WANT A HEALTHY, HEALTHY BABY!!!You are all in my thoughts all the time.Hugs to all!

Hi All;Today was my 3rd u/s and it went good THANK GOD &  the baby heart beat is at 185.  My DH & I saw the hands, head, tummy and baby was moving & seem like the baby was waving at us, I couldn't hold back I cried.  I am sooo Thankful never thougth I would be pregnant.  No symptoms at all just nipples hurt bad..=D

I had my 12 week scan today and the pics are amazing, I asked if he could see the gender and he had a look, he turned around and I have a pic of his wee bum, legs in the air and YIP its def a boy....... ha ha the pic is cool. even though at 12 weeks the have to tell you they cant guarantee it but he looked and smiled and said yip its a boy ha ha haBig hugs to allxx
Hematoma grew after a big bleed last night.  Babies OK but hope it heals soon.
Glad babies are OK, saying a wee prayer for you and the 2 beautiful lil ones :-)Big hugsx
Thank you SM - congratulations on your little guy!!!Hurray Cleto!Lala - what about eBay for a Snoogle?Thosenewman - glad your hematoma is gone!!!Redhead & Mintaverez - good lluck on Tuesday!

Sorry, I know how scary it can be! What does your doctor have you doing right now?I'm hoping mine will show evidence that it is completely resolved on my follow up on Monday. I'd like to get back to work and moving around more. I'm getting to that stage where I feel yucky and fat lolTO: ScottishmummyThey were able to see the gender already?! That's awesome! At my 12 week scan my doc didn't even try! What kind of u/s did you have?

Thank you Scottishmummy and ThosenewmansThe doc has me on bed rest.  He said there is nothing else I can do.  I'm trying to drink lots as well.  Did your doc tell you anything else to do, TN?  So you were on bed rest too?  Did you have a bleed, is that how yours started?SG

I am soo sorry to hear your on bedrest!  I cant imagine how nervous you must have been.  I am so glad to hear the babies are fine!!Ladies...congrats!!  This is so exciting for all of us!I am due May 6th and love this group!  Good job storkgirl!  You rock!

Hi, I asked him if he saw anything could he tell me, I said I know its not 100% gaurenteed but give me his opinion, so at the end he said OK lets see what we see, he moved it and went around his little bum, his legs where in the air and then he said OH YIP, your having a boy.... and it was clearly there, a boy. There is a gender test I done to called the gender test. www.intelligender.com  and you pee in that one and if it goes a yellow/orange color then its a girl, if it goes green/dark brown then its a boy.... and YES mine went green/dark brown ha ha I know again its not 100% but I am going for a 16 week 4d scan and they are 99% correct with the gender, so I will wait a few more week ha ha.Good luck on Monday, here's hoping for great results.Big hugsxx

Hi girlsI have read and my Doc said if possible sleep on your left side as it helps benefit your baby(ies) by improving blood flow – and therefore nutrients – to the placenta. It also helps your kidneys efficiently eliminate waste products and fluids from your body, which in turn reduces swelling in your ankles, feet, and hands., my 1st couple of weeks I was so tired but couldnt sleep for Restless Leg Syndrome. but now its getting better, and Im finding myself sleeping more on my left sideBig hugs x

Yeah, being on bed rest stinks, but it's worth it! Since I spend the whole day laying around, I switch it up. Sometimes I even sit up! lol That's exciting!Being this early in the pregnancy, it is not unsafe to lay on your back, but Scottishmummy is right, your left side is the best side to lay on for those exact reasons. They recommend beginning to lay on your side by the 20th week of pregnancy, but since I am a back sleeper, I have been working on it. It's hard to sleep on your side when you are not used to it!!

It's so fun to see how this group is growing...I love all the IVF success stories....we've all been through a lot to get here...@ Storkgirl--though I'm not a vegetarian, I don't eat much meat..I've been  making lots of homemade soups to get more protein, etc. (i.e. split pea, minestrone with lots of beans and spinach, stuff like that). I remember you from the other forum as well....I'm so glad the process worked out for you!@ everyone--looks like I'm not alone with the sleeping issues. Guess I need to invest in a Snoogle or something like that too.I also FINALLY got back my combined genetic screening results today--I just got a letter in the mail saying I am "low risk" and do not require further testing. I wish I would have gotten a ratio like some of you ladies....but I'll be content with this.We find out the gender this Friday...I'm dying for a boy! We'll see.......

SG-Yeah I am BIG on lentils. I mix it with organic chunky salsa for chili.  Lately I try to have a big salad every day, too. Lately I've been eating broccoli. I stir fry chopped garlic in olive oil, steam a ton of broccoli, and then pour the garlic mixture in with the broccoli, add lemon juice, and fresh parmesan cheese. It's amazing! It doesn't have whole protein I don't think, but I get my veggies in. I'm also big on V8s. I have cravings for those. Actually this morning I woke up at 4 am and couldn't beat a craving for a melted cheese and tomato sandwich. I've never even made one before! I got out of bed, ate one, and then back to bed it was! Oh, what stomach support did you end up getting. is it good?Thosenewmans- Congrats on getting off bed rest!Jennie and Everyone- I have trouble with sleep, too. I just read to put a pillow behind your back, between your knees, under your stomach and under your head. I already have two memory foam pillows and I think Ill buy two more.  Jennie, hope you hear it's a boy and congrats on the low risk status!

Thanks Thosenewmans!!Yes, still on bed rest.  We'll see how the u/s goes on Tuesday and what the new doc has to say.  Coming off is getting closer though!OK, so I don't have aliens - that's good to know!

SG:Did you end up getting a stomach support? Which kind? I'm so jealous you have a multiples clinic! Thanks LalaI am hopeful for Tuesday!  When your hematoma went away did you resume all activity right away?  I feel very lucky to get the ob I have.  I've seen him on TV a few times, he is the guy here for twins/triplets for sure. I hope he's nice to his patients.  My fertility doc said he does 60% vaginal/40% c section.  If things are well and the babies are in position he wants you to do vaginal apparently.  I have an u/s before my appointment so I'll ask about the cervix length.  They might not do a trans vag u/s until the hematoma is gone, I'm not sure.I was very surprised to learn where the babies are a few u/s ago.  They are well below my bellybutton.  Baby A is right in the middle (the tech told me  with multiples they always name the baby closest to the cervix baby A and this baby will always deliver first) and Baby B is off to the right side.  When they are measuring the hematoma, they are always on the left side.Hope everyone is doing well.  SG

Yep, I was told normal activities the day my hematoma was gone!It took a few days of walking (5 minutes at a time) without feeling winded. I want to start on a 15 minute walk every three days and then build to 45 minutes, but I want to wait until after next week's ultrasound. I was an avid exerciser before I got pregnant, but I think I'll exercise as if i were a beginner for the pregnancy.  Are you planning on exercising?If my calculations are correct, the amount of hematoma that bled out in a week makes Tuesday totally feasible, no?I am excited to find out your OB schedule/treatment so I can emulate it here!

Wow - normal activity would be great!  It will take me some time to build up as well.  I'm winded walking to the bathroom :-)I am a runner but I'm not sure about exercising.  I had a book out from the library about twins, triplets and quads and it actually recommended just walking.  I walk an hour a day (to and from work) so I might just stick with that, but I also don't want to be crazy out of shape for delivering babies!  A girl at work had twins a couple of weeks ago (went to the same clinic as me).  She is a physiotherapist and she stopped excercising after the transfer.  She did really well and made it to 37 weeks so I'm not sure what to do.I think it could be gone byTuesday!!!  I've been crampy and then had a fair amount of shedding today - I'm hopeful!!!!

I also resumed all my normal activities. Doc said it was fine but to be smart. Don't over work yourself or lift heavy objects, stuff like that.Like lala said, the first day was hard. I was so tired and used to inactivity! But now I am pretty much back to how I was before. :)

Dull light menstrual- like cramps in pelvic region today. It's happened before I guess it will happen again.
How are you doing Lala?  I seem to be crampy a lot of the time these days.  Not sure if it is the growing and stretching...

Yesterday the cramps was all day...very dull and light. And then I went to the supermarket and was standing a lot and it got intense. I felt wet, and I was sure I was bleeding, but I wasn't. I wasn't even wet like I thought. Ugh, the tricks of the mind! It wasn't twangy  painful cramps, it was achey cramps, but they got strong until I sat. I actually think they get worse when I put my Cabea stomach support belt on! I think it's happened a few times with that belt.Anyway, I think 15 weeks + (maybe especially for twins) there's a lot more stretching going on. For obvious reasons, I hate the period cramp ones, but I read it is totally normal.I tried on my Babyhugger, and although it isn't fashionable, I think it's the best and will be GREAT in about 4 weeks. I haven't worn it out yet because It's  like a  maternal- teddy- straight- jacket, and maybe I don't really need it yet. But sometimes I think I should get a head start on keeping the babies off my pelvis and cervix.To Everyone: I'm going to post my belly soon (and I'm not that type of girl), but I think it would be fun to compare bellies since many of us our so close in gestational age. Plus Im really curious about other people's sizes. My face will not be part of the pic. It's just not me. What do you think? Too shy? Not interested?

Ligament Stretching"During the second trimester, which begins with the 14th week, the muscles and ligaments that support the uterus begin stretching. Around the 15th week a woman will begin to have a belly bump. This is due to the uterus growing enough to extend from its normal position. The ligaments, or tough bands of tissue, have to stretch to accommodate the growing. This can cause pain in the abdomen and pelvic region. Some women may recognize this as muscle pain, but to other women it may feel like menstrual cramping. The pain may be more frequent on one side of the body over the other. Moving, such as getting out of bed or coughing, can activate the pain. Resting and moving more slowly are the best ways to relieve the discomfort."Read more: http://www.livestrong.com/article/123182-causes-mild-cramps-weeks-pregnant/#ixzz1eEt8R881

I'm so glad you weren't bleeding Lala, that must have been scary until you checked it out.  Sometimes I swear I'm bleeding too, I'm still on high alert, would be nice to let that feeling go.  Yes, the menstrual pain is the worst, we are so used to a blood association with that type of pain.Thanks for the info on stretching.  I would definately be into posting photos after my hematoma is gone (it's still shedding).  I'm only using my lap top during bed rest and don't have my camera software on it.  My belly is up to 39 inches.  My friend who had twins at 37 weeks went up to 46 inches.  I'm feeling quite off balance when I stand up.  I haven't weighed myself in a while.  I'm hoping to do the 24 lbs by 24 weeks.I haven't bought a tummy support yet.  I've felt too bad to ask my husband to find me one since he is doing all the cooking and housework these days.  I will get one soon.  The baby hugger looks great.  Is it possible to wear it under your clothing?Is everyone using belly creams?  I've been bad at using them for some reason.  I have Bio Oil and The Body Shop's Cocoa Butter stick (which used to be packaged for pregnant moms when I worked there back in my university days).  My u/s tech recommended Vichy's stretch mark cream.SG

Hi everyone.Well went for my 4th u/s and baby is still a week behine but growing very good.  Now they just want to do a 5th u/s to see more better if my baby has any down syndrome features.  Now I am worried here.  Any one knows when they do that I will be 12 weeks tomorrow and I am 35 years old.  IDK what to think.Are we ever going to stop worring??

Hi CletoVery happy to hear that your baby is growing well.  The ultrasound for Down Syndrome (nuchal translucency ultrasound) is usually done between 12 - 14 weeks.  This is a test that they do for everyone at most fertility clinics.  Try not to worry Cleto.  You are just 35 and the risk increases only slightly for each year over 35.

Thank so much I feel better.  So have you had yours done already??  Yeah my RE said those Doc has way better u/s & also 3D & 4D so they will have a better view of my baby...Thank You So Much.  How have you been??

Hi CletoYes, I had mine done at 12.5 weeks.  Make sure you get it done within the time period of 12-14 weeks because I don't think it is acurate after that.  Yes, part of the test was done in 4D.  There is also a blood test that goes with it.I have an appointment tomorrow afternoon, hoping my hematoma is resolving.Having sleep issues...:-(

Amnio is when they collect a sample of the amniotic fluid that your baby lives in to get more information on the health of the baby. It is preformed for various reasons but can also be done if you are high risk or if your NT scan suggests more information is needed.

I'm jst nearly 13wks and iv still been taking the cyclogest pessaries as had red fresh blood a few weeks ago are you taking those or did you stop when you found out you were preg? Congrats on twins by the way that is fab

Hi Louis82I will be 17 weeks tomoorow.  When I had my first bleed I had 2.5 days left of the hormones and my doc told me to finish them.  I was also on baby aspirin.  My doc took me off that right away as it acts as a blood thinner.  I don't believe it would cause the hematoma though.  I was told by the doc it's usually constipation, lifting, even a bad cough (basically anything that involves your ab muscles).  One of my nurses said it could also be due to the high dose of hormones we are on as it is seen often in ivf.I hadn't heard of it before either until one of the members here on Med Help had the same thing.  When I went to my ob on Tuesday I was seen at 3:00 p.m.  The nurse told me I was the third patient with a hematoma that she had seen since 1:00 p.m. that day.  I was told that it is not causing a problem for the babies right now and try not to think about it.  It is hard to do that when you still have brown blood shedding but my doc said there are many worse things.  Still, I can't wait until we are rid of this!SG

I know me to can't wait to get rid of it going for a scan tomorrow so will see what's happening hopefuly haemtoma shrinking I will speak to my doc about the baby asprin was just worryed stopping it like that thanks for the info on how we may get these things I really didn't know how common it was in ivf preg I wish you luck with yours and hope for best

Hi ladiesSorry to sneak in but I have got BFP on my HPT's and just waiting on my beta numbers today. I had 2 embryos transfered and would love to know from everyone what your beta numbers were even if you are pregnant with a singleton or twin?Thanks I appreciate it.

Hi - ThanksBeen a tough couple of months but sounds like you have been through it too. Was also on bedrest for awhile and was going crazy just lying there.  At least we're over the danger period and can only pray that all goes well :).  NO idea on the gender- think we may let it be a surprise in April.  Starting to get excited now too and keep thinking "move baby move"  haha - this little one just doesn't want me to feel him/her.  I'm growing bigger each dayStruggling to sleep too as I'm not used to trying to sleep on my side and it's giving me such bad backache - but I'll take it all as long as this little one arrives safe and sound:)

I guess we have both been through a lot! But I kind of expected it...it wasn't easy to get pregnant and I figured it wouldn't be easy to stay that way. :) But it is so worth it!I don't know if I could wait to find out the gender, but that has got to be exciting!Well, I can't wait to get to the end with you! So glad we get to do this together ;)TO: anetskiThese are my beta numbers for a singleton from September 9 - October 11.135544105710,87435,80767,95994,639

I got this AMAZING book!"When You're Expecting Twins, Triplets, or Quads: Proven Guidelines for a Healthy Multiple Pregnancy, 3rd Edition" Luke, Barbara; Paperback; $13.59It doesn't scare you about twin complications. It's really a personal cheerleader/motivator that answers all your questions and gives you every confidence that you will have a healthy pregnancy. You feel like you have so much more control over the pregnancy!
I have that book too Lala!  I renewed it twice from the library now but will buy it soon.
Just wanted to say GOOD LUCK to all you girls... I was in your thread for IVF Aug/Sept but got a BFN... you give me hope for the next time! Wishing you all the best on your journey ;)
Hi Blue28Good luck for when you start your next venture. Sending loads & Loads of baby dust and lots of prayers.Fingers crossedBig hugsXoxo

I swore I would never complain about any pregnancy symptoms...but I am starting to feel so yucky! My little sister took some fall photos for us yesterday. Pre-pregnancy, I knew who I was (I'm not super skinny, but I'm not fat by any means...I was pear shaped and short..but I was ok with all of that). Now I feel pale, chubby and awkward.I'm sure I'm not alone...but how do you guys deal with the weight gain of pregnancy?
I guess I've got to figure out my new figure!! Lol

Thosenewmans - you are so funny!!  At first all my weight was in my tummy & chest, but now my face looks fatter.  I think one of the more disturbing things is little tiny veins in my face showing up.  I had :the glow" for about two weeks and now I have "the bland!"  I was hoping to find some cute tops but not so on bed rest.  Luckily I bought two pairs of mat pants prior, but I'm in a bind for tops for sure!!Everyone - are you using stretch mark creams?

I went though the same thing! At thirteen and fourteen weeks, I felt unattractive, not sexy, not like myself, and my "fat pants" were too tight, even around the legs. BUT...,once I got into the "pregnant, not fat," stage of showing, it all changed. I could embrace my new body, and was proud. I love my bigger body now! Im having twins so the showing part happened quickly. In one week ( by 15 weeks), I looked more  pregnant than fat and acquaintances started asking.It also helped that I  was out of the first trimester and could get the gray out of my hair and have my nails done.Personally I think my problem  was also about how society and/or family conditions me into believing that having a few extra pounds is wrong. Because of it, I  was slightly embarrassed, and couldn't wait to look pregnant not fat so I would "feel" more accepted. But that's just me. Im not saying this is you at all, your thoughts just got me thinking.I hope that this will help me after the pregnancy while losing weight or even if I gain. Maybe I wont come down on myself for not being the "ideal" that is stuck in my head. Anyway... sorry...I'm getting off track.... I think you'll feel great when you have a good bump going. I felt better!

Oh my Gosh!!! I have tiny veins in my face, too! My husband noticed them first.I am using, avocado oil on my stomach and breasts. My husband bought me something specifically for stretch marks but it has vitamin A, which I hear is a "no". Strange for a pregnancy stretch mark cream! Anyway, I heard either you get them or you don't and that if you are prone, nothing will really work to prevent them. Did your mother get them? That's a predictor I hear. I just heard to moisturize moisturize moisturize to prevent itching, and if you do get them maybe they wont look as bad???

hehe well I did go buy some new tops, which was super fun (I even tried on the fake belly and had a few giggles), but you are both right, I am just in the "inbetween" stage.I was comfortable before, and I will be comfortable again...I just need to adjust.As far as shedding the pounds afterwards...all the focus will be on the baby so no one will notice me ;)I started using Blooming Beautiful Bump Butter. The ladies at the maternity store swear by it. I already have stretch marks, so I am assuming I will get them, but I will try anything!

I heard that's the best, too,but I cant get anything in Uruguay.My poor Mom. When she comes in February she going to have everything from breast pumps, to Woombies, to sling baby carriers in her suitcase.
hi allI am so interested in knowing your beta numbers for your first bloodtest and on which day you had them done.thanks
I posted mine for you already. I believe my first 2-3 were about 2-3 days apart. Once they got past the 3rd or 4th test, they were weekly.

Hi AllIs anyone else on Synthroid?  If so, when do you take your pill?  I've been told to take it 2 hours after food and 1 hour before food.  Since I'm eating small portions for most of the day, I haven't been able to find a three hour window.  I usually take it in the middle of the night when I get up to go to the bathroom but the odd time I sleep through and miss it.  Just wondered what others in the group are doing.Thanks!  SG
Hi I'm not on Synthroid SG, but I have a question, too. Is anyone on Calcium, Magnesium and Zinc supplements?

Hi LalaI was told to take 500mg of calcium at my last appointment.  Usually magnesium goes with that - I'll have to ask at my apointment tomorrow...I'm not currently on zinc on it's own.  I'm on a prenatal multi that has 1mg of folic acid.  I take an additional 4 mg for a total of 5 mg folic acid.I'm also on B12.SG

Hi LalaI was told to take 500mg of calcium at my last appointment.  Usually magnesium goes with that - I'll have to ask at my apointment tomorrow...I'm not currently on zinc on it's own.  I'm on a prenatal multi that has 1mg of folic acid.  I take an additional 4 mg for a total of 5 mg folic acid.I'm also on B12.SG

I wrote the doctor who wrote our book! I paid 50 bucks for a nutrition and health analysis. (With it, I get free advice whenever I need it.)She told me to take double the recommended does of of my calcium- mag- zinc supplement, and I am a little scared of overdose or doing something negative to the babies.  I am obviously  also scared to ask her about this since I already told her how many mgs were in my supplement.She wrote this about the supplement: "This combination significantly reducees the risk for preeclampsia--which you are at higher risk for with your age and twins. All three minerals are very therapeutic--for blood pressure, preterm labor, and infection."PS: I have pregnancy carpal tunnel!!!!!!!

Hi Lala - That sounds great.  I may do that too - I don't want to be doing any harm with a vegetarian diet.  I took quite a few supplements before I went to my dietician.  She took me off everything except the multi and wants me to get everything I need from food.  But how do I know I'm getting everything through diet that I need?I'm taking about 4 Tums per day for acid reflux.  Each one has 750 mg of calcium,  I showed my nurse practitioner and she said she still wants me on an extra 500 mg.  That's fine, but I don't need a kidney stone right now...I had carpal tunnel for a couple of days but then went away.  So far it hasn't come back. Maybe yours will go soon!

Hi All;I had my 1st dr appointment today & everything went well.  Tomorrow I have an acupuncture appointment and then on Friday on 12/2/11 I have an appointment with a specializes in maternal & fetal.I am glad everyone is doing good.

I'm on Zinc supplements, B-6, B-12, baby aspirin, folate (folic acid but a super high dosage), pre-natal, vitamin C.I need to look into adding calcium and mag.TO: storkgirlI'm on levothyroxine and I take it first thing in the AM before food. I wait to take any vitamins until lunch time so no meds are affected.

This is what is on my doctor's website, but I guess check with your doc first:)"Calcium is critical for healthy bones throughout the life cycle, but during pregnancy it also has the double role of reducing the risk of developing preeclampsia. This dangerous complication of pregnancy is more common among women pregnant for the first time as well as those who are expecting multiples.Magnesium helps to prevent premature labor by minimizing uterine contractions. It also lowers the baby's risk of cerebral palsy or other developmental disabilities because it protects the developing nervous system, even if the baby is born early.Zinc is vital for the healthy development of the baby's nervous system. Plus, it reduces the risk of infection-whether or not a woman is pregnant. All three of these minerals also help with the common complaints of heartburn, leg cramps, and insomnia.Nature Made Brand makes a Calcium and Magnesium with Zinc supplement which contains, per tablet, 333 mg of calcium, 133 mg of magnesium, and 5 mg of zinc. For nonpregnant women, the daily dose is three tablets. For women pregnant with singletons, the dose is six tablets.For women pregnant with multiples, the dose is nine tablets (sorry-minerals are bulky). I began taking this wonderful supplement many years ago for migraine headaches-and I haven't had a recurrence in years. If possible, take the larger amounts (six-nine tablets) in divided doses."

question: Hi ThereI would love to connect with those having babies this spring.  I underwent a 3-day donor egg IVF transfer in August 2011 and am expecting twins in April 2012.Stork Girl
title: IVF Pregnancies - Due in Spring 2012!
